meanings.definition: To separate or isolate information or data within a specific department or group.
meanings.sent1: In our project, we are siloing the research data to keep it organized.
meanings.sent2: The company is siloing the marketing team from the sales team to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The IT department joked about siloing the coffee machine to prevent others from using it.
meanings.sent4: She felt like siloing her thoughts to focus better on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The farmer was siloing the grain to store it safely for the winter.

meanings.definition: The act of creating barriers or divisions between different teams or departments within an organization.
meanings.sent1: Siloing in the workplace can hinder collaboration between teams.
meanings.sent2: The siloing of information between departments led to miscommunication.
meanings.sent3: The office manager found humor in the constant siloing of the office supplies.
meanings.sent4: The siloing of ideas can limit innovation within the company.
meanings.sent5: The strict siloing of responsibilities made it hard for employees to work together effectively.
